com.zephyr.pixy

Class Pixy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zephyr.pixy.Pixy

  • public class Pixy
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class that manages it all. It allows you to create a reference to a Pixy using 3 of the possible communication types available on the Pixy and retrieve the object detections from the Pixy.
    Author:
    Bradley Bickford

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static short CC_SYNC_WORD
      The value of a color code detection sync word
      static int DEFAULT_I2C_ADDR
      The default I2C address of the Pixy
      static int DEFAULT_MAX_OBJECTS
      The default maximum number of objects that can be detected by the Pixy at one time
      static int DEFAULT_UART_BAUD
      The default UART baud rate for the Pixy
      static short NORMAL_SYNC_WORD
      The value of a normal detection sync word
      static short OUT_OF_SYNC_WORD
      The value of a sync word that is out of sync, we've read too many bytes or missed a byte somewhere and this can be used to get us back in sync when looking for the values we need.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.I2C.Port port, int maxAllowedObjects)
      Create a new Pixy object with a specific I2C port and a maximum number of allowable objects.
      Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.I2C.Port port, int address, int maxAllowedObjects)
      Create a new Pixy object with a specific I2C port, an I2C address, and a maximum number of allowable objects
      Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SerialPort.Port port, int maxAllowedObjects)
      Create a new Pixy object with a specific SerialPort port and a maximum number of allowable objects The default SerialPort buad rate for the Pixy is used with this constructor
      Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SerialPort.Port port, int baudRate, int maxAllowedObjects)
      Create a new Pixy object with a specific SerialPort port, a baud rate, and a maximum number of allowable objects
      Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SPI.Port port, int maxAllowedObjects)
      Create a new Pixy object with a specific SPI port and a maximum number of allowable objects

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PixyDetection[] getAllDetectedObjects()
      Updates the entire set of detection objects and returns the entire array of objects
      PixyDetection getDetectedObject(int detectionNum)
      Updates the entire set of detection objects and returns the one that you specifically want.
      void setBrightness(java.lang.Short brightness)
      Sends information to the Pixy to adjust the brightness (exposure) of the camera itself, note that the Short value is converted to an 8 bit value ranging from 0-255.
      void setLED(java.lang.Short red, java.lang.Short green, java.lang.Short blue)
      Sends information to the Pixy to adjust the color of the LED.
      void setPanTilt(java.lang.Short pan, java.lang.Short tilt)
      Sends information to the Pixy to adjust the pan and tilt of the Pixy using the servo mount attachment TODO Verify this works with SPI specifically, while it needs to be verified with all communication types, SPI might have to ordered Big Endian not little Endian

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pixy

        public Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.I2C.Port port,
            int maxAllowedObjects)
        Create a new Pixy object with a specific I2C port and a maximum number of allowable objects. The default I2C address for the Pixy is used with this constructor
        Parameters:
        port - The I2C port to communicate on
        maxAllowedObjects - The maximum number of objects

      • Pixy

        public Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.I2C.Port port,
            int address,
            int maxAllowedObjects)
        Create a new Pixy object with a specific I2C port, an I2C address, and a maximum number of allowable objects
        Parameters:
        port - The I2C port to communicate on
        address - The I2C address to talk to
        maxAllowedObjects - The maximum number of objects

      • Pixy

        public Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SerialPort.Port port,
            int maxAllowedObjects)
        Create a new Pixy object with a specific SerialPort port and a maximum number of allowable objects The default SerialPort buad rate for the Pixy is used with this constructor
        Parameters:
        port - The SerialPort port to communicate on
        maxAllowedObjects - The maximum number of objects

      • Pixy

        public Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SerialPort.Port port,
            int baudRate,
            int maxAllowedObjects)
        Create a new Pixy object with a specific SerialPort port, a baud rate, and a maximum number of allowable objects
        Parameters:
        port - The SerialPort port to communicate on
        baudRate - The baud rate to use for this connections
        maxAllowedObjects - The maximum number of objects

      • Pixy

        public Pixy(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SPI.Port port,
            int maxAllowedObjects)
        Create a new Pixy object with a specific SPI port and a maximum number of allowable objects
        Parameters:
        port - The SPI port to communicate on
        maxAllowedObjects - The maximum number of objects

    • Method Detail

      • getDetectedObject

        public PixyDetection getDetectedObject(int detectionNum)
        Updates the entire set of detection objects and returns the one that you specifically want. This method uses array indexing notation, so detection numbers start from 0, and range to maxAllowedObjects - 1
        Parameters:
        detectionNum - The number of the detection that you want to retrieve
        Returns:
        Returns the detection that is associated with the detectionNum array position, or null if that position doesn't exist or isn't filled in

      • getAllDetectedObjects

        public PixyDetection[] getAllDetectedObjects()
        Updates the entire set of detection objects and returns the entire array of objects
        Returns:
        The entire array of PixyDetection objects

      • setPanTilt

        public void setPanTilt(java.lang.Short pan,
                       java.lang.Short tilt)
        Sends information to the Pixy to adjust the pan and tilt of the Pixy using the servo mount attachment TODO Verify this works with SPI specifically, while it needs to be verified with all communication types, SPI might have to ordered Big Endian not little Endian
        Parameters:
        pan - The pan of the Pixy camera, ranging from 0 to 1000
        tilt - The tilt of the Pixy camera, ranging from 0 to 1000

      • setBrightness

        public void setBrightness(java.lang.Short brightness)
        Sends information to the Pixy to adjust the brightness (exposure) of the camera itself, note that the Short value is converted to an 8 bit value ranging from 0-255. This is to circumvent the fact that Java has no nice way of specifying a parameter as unsigned TODO Verify this works with SPI specifically, while it needs to be verified with all communication types, SPI might have to be ordered Big Endian not little Endian
        Parameters:
        brightness - The new brightness

      • setLED

        public void setLED(java.lang.Short red,
                   java.lang.Short green,
                   java.lang.Short blue)
        Sends information to the Pixy to adjust the color of the LED. Note that the Short values are converted to and 8 bit value ranging from 0-255. This is to circumvent the fact that Java has no nice way of specifiying a parameter as unsigned TODO Verify this works with SPI specifically, while it needs to be verified with all communication types, SPI might have to be ordered Big Endian not little Endian
        Parameters:
        red - The red component for the LED
        green - The green component for the LED
        blue - The blue component for the LED
